qas.question: What gender was expected to be conscripted into the military?
At what age could a male common expect to be conscripted into the military?
How long could a conscripted soldier expect to be in training for?
What was the lowest age a soldier could be conscripted after the end of Emperor Zhao's tenure?
Which Minister could a conscripted soldier expect to serve under during his year of service?

context: At the beginning of the Han dynasty, every <a0_0>male<a0_0/> commoner aged <a1_0>twenty-three<a1_0/> was liable for conscription into the military. The minimum age for the military draft was reduced to <a3_0>twenty<a3_0/> after Emperor Zhao's (r. 87–74 BC) reign. Conscripted soldiers underwent <a2_0>one year<a2_0/> of training and one year of service as non-professional soldiers. The year of training was served in one of three branches of the armed forces: infantry, cavalry or navy. The year of active service was served either on the frontier, in a king's court or under the <a4_0>Minister of the Guards<a4_0/> in the capital. A small professional (paid) standing army was stationed near the capital.
